frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Theme to move with respect to a certain Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.
An Agent who is engaged in an Undertaking accords a Degree of importance to a Consideration that influences the success of an Undertaking.
An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.
frameExamples: Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
Our company <t>emphasizes</t> marketing tried and true products and services.INI
Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon, we each <t>exchanged</t> $50 for Uzbek currency with a shifty loiterer in the lobby at the rate .
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Theme</fen> identifies the object involved in motion.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the motion in place.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role  identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
An event or state of affairs, an attribute, or an entity whose properties have the potential to influence the success of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual who devotes time, concentration, or other resources to a <fen>Consideration</fen> that is important for the success of a larger <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Competing_consideration</fen> is another factor that is relevant to the <fen>Undertaking</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen> devotes less attention or effort.
The <fen>Artifact</fen> is a physical object designed with some <fen>Consideration</fen> in mind, such that it functions to facilitate the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is performed with importance placed on the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches a specified degree of importance to the <fen>Consideration</fen> to further the success of the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches the specified level of importance  to the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The person who exchanges <fen>Sum_1</fen> for <fen>Sum_2</fen>.
An amount of money in the <fen>Source_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> exchanges for an amount in the <fen>Target_currency</fen>.
The kind of currency of the <fen>Money_owner</fen> has before the exchange.
The amount of money in the <fen>Target_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives in exchange for <fen>Sum_1</fen>.
The kind of currency that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives as part of the exchange.
Currency that is being exchanged by the <fen>Money_owner</fen>.
The time when the currency is exchanged.
The location where the money is exchanged.

Dell said Friday <fex>the company</fex> will put more emphasis on selling software

Result Oriented <fex>Management</fex>
<fex>In the 1960s</fex> Foucault placed great weight on the notion of archeology.
<fex>In Arizona</fex> we emphasize western bats with a special focus on species identification.
